text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion asks for the main purpose (object) of the GIP stated by its constitutive convention. The candidate answer correctly identifies that the determination of the personnel regime (public vs. private law) rests entirely on the 'convention constitutive' (founding agreement) of the GIP, which is the document that defines the GIP's structure and operation, including its object and the rules governing its personnel. While the answer focuses on the personnel regime aspect, it repeatedly emphasizes that the 'convention constitutive' is the source of authority for the choice of regime, thereby directly addressing the central role of this document in defining the GIP's operational framework as established by its founding agreement.", "criterion_id": "8c55b6db-d9ed-4c5c-9d24-70d05b2a3aec"}
